Package pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
pl.edu.agh.kis.pz1.model.Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents a poker game with a list of players, a deck of cards, and game state. It handles game initialization, player addition, game state transitions, and game rules such as blinds and pot management.

  • Field Details

    • gameID

      protected String gameID

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(String gameID)
      Constructor to initialize the game with the specified game ID. This method also initializes the deck and shuffles it.
      Parameters:
      gameID - The unique identifier for the game.

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player newPlayer)
      Adds a new player to the game. The game must be in the "waiting for players" state, and the player must not exceed the maximum number of players.
      Parameters:
      newPlayer - The player to add to the game.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the game is not in the "waiting for players" state, or if the maximum player count is reached.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String playerId)
      Removes a player from the game based on the player's unique ID. If no players remain after the removal, the game will be reset.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player to remove from the game.

    • setPlayerReady

      public void setPlayerReady(String playerId)
      Marks a player as ready to start the game. If all players are ready, the game will automatically start.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player to mark as ready.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is no player with the given ID.

    • getNumberOfReadyPlayers

      public int getNumberOfReadyPlayers()
      Returns the number of players who are marked as ready.
      Returns:
      The number of ready players.

    • canStartGame

      public boolean canStartGame()
      Checks whether the game can start. The game can start only if there are at least the minimum required number of players, and all players are marked as ready.
      Returns:
      True if the game can start, false otherwise.

    • startGameCycle

      public void startGameCycle()
      Starts the game cycle, initializing the necessary steps for a new round of the game. This includes setting up the dealer, small blind, and big blind players, resetting the game state, and starting the initial stages of the round: posting blinds, dealing cards, and starting the first betting round.

    • getInfoBlinds

      public String getInfoBlinds()
      Retrieves information about the current small blind and big blind players, as well as the amounts that have been placed for each.
      Returns:
      A string with information about the small blind and big blind.

    • dealCards

      public void dealCards()
      Deals 5 cards to each player by drawing from a shuffled deck. The deck is shuffled before cards are dealt to ensure randomness. Each player receives 5 cards, which are assigned to their hand.

    • getPlayerHand

      public String getPlayerHand(String playerID)
      Retrieves the hand of a specific player, displaying the cards they have been dealt. If no cards have been dealt yet, it returns a message indicating that.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The ID of the player whose hand is being requested.
      Returns:
      A string describing the player's hand, or a message indicating no cards have been dealt.

    • playerFold

      public void playerFold(String playerId)
      Allows a player to fold during the betting round. The player will not participate further in the current round, and the remaining number of active players is decreased. If only one player remains, the game state is set to GAME_OVER.
      Parameters:
      playerId - The ID of the player who wishes to fold.

    • playerCall
